annotation_sentence: Yes, um, I have time. We talk about the deadline, right?
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: agreement ('Yes'), hesitation ('um'), statement of availability ('I have time'), confirmation request ('We talk about the deadline, right?').

annotation_sentence: Hm, I think I go well, but some part is, um, how to say... difficult.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: hesitation ('Hm'), expression of opinion ('I think'), self-assessment ('I go well'), contrast ('but'), uncertainty ('um', 'how to say'), and evaluation ('difficult').

annotation_sentence: Maybe, yes. I think I need more, um, what is... guide? For the process.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: uncertainty ('Maybe'), agreement ('yes'), expression of opinion ('I think'), request for assistance ('I need more'), hesitation ('um'), clarification request ('what is'), and specification ('For the process').

annotation_sentence: Yes, guidance! That would be, um, very helpful. Thank you.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: agreement ('Yes'), confirmation ('guidance'), expression of potential ('That would be'), hesitation ('um'), evaluation ('very helpful'), and gratitude ('Thank you').

annotation_sentence: Yes, I think so. But I worry about time. I have, um, many task to finish.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: agreement ('Yes'), expression of opinion ('I think so'), contrast ('But'), expression of concern ('I worry about time'), statement of possession ('I have'), hesitation ('um'), and statement of obligation ('many task to finish').

annotation_sentence: I need maybe one... um, one more week? To finish, um, everything.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: expression of need ('I need'), uncertainty ('maybe'), hesitation ('um'), request for time ('one more week'), purpose ('To finish'), and generalization ('everything').

annotation_sentence: Thank you. I will work hard to finish all part.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: gratitude ('Thank you'), promise ('I will work hard'), purpose ('to finish'), and specification ('all part').

annotation_sentence: Yes, I will do that. Thank you for, um, understanding.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: agreement ('Yes'), promise ('I will do that'), gratitude ('Thank you'), hesitation ('um'), and appreciation ('understanding').

annotation_sentence: Yes, we are team. I feel, um, better now.
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: agreement ('Yes'), statement of unity ('we are team'), expression of feeling ('I feel'), hesitation ('um'), and improvement ('better now').

annotation_sentence: Yes, we will finish it well. Thank you again!
rationale: The sentence contains multiple speech acts: agreement ('Yes'), promise ('we will finish it well'), and repeated gratitude ('Thank you again').
